title: Bihar Cop Had To Swear In Name Of 'Chhati Maiya' On A Written Note To Get Leave Approved!
text:
Bihar Cop Had To Swear In Name Of 'Chhati Maiya' On A Written Note To Get Leave Approved!

Bihar Cop Had To Swear In Name Of 'Chhati Maiya' On A Written Note To Get Leave Approved!

The four day festival of Chhath Puja will begin on November 2. For those who do not know, Chhath is celebrated to express gratitude to nature and connect with it. Imagine it to be the Indian thanksgiving festival which is devoted to the Sun God Surya and his Sister Shashti devi (Chhathi Maiya). People thank the Sun God for supporting and sustaining life on our planet and seek his blessings and protection.

The festival is mainly celebrated in the states of Bihar, Jharkhand and UP.

PTI

Given how big a festival it is in Bihar, people are naturally sentimental about it and Chhathi Maiya is a idol figure there. You know how we used to say in our childhood to make people not break their swear, ‘mummy ki kasam kha’? That is exactly what happened with a cop in Bihar.

Meanwhile, in Bihar’s Samastipur a cop had to swear in the name of “Chhatthi Mayya” to get his leave approved by the SSP. Here’s the “Shapath patra” he signed to apply for leave!

“If I m lying, God please punish me and my family”.

Bihar Police for you! pic.twitter.com/OxVguSLOvb — Prashant Kumar (@scribe_prashant) October 29, 2019

Journalist Prashant Kumar tweeted the leave application of a cop with the caption, ‘Meanwhile, in Bihar’s Samastipur a cop had to swear in the name of “Chhatthi Mayya” to get his leave approved by the SSP. Here’s the “Shapath patra” he signed to apply for leave!

Don't Miss 14.8 K SHARES 4.4 K SHARES 4.7 K SHARES 4.2 K SHARES 4.3 K SHARES

“If I m lying, God please punish me and my family”.

Bihar Police for you!’

In the application the cop had to swear that he had been praying to Chhathi Maiya for the past 40 years and if he was lying, his whole family would suffer.

It is kind of funny though, if the cop was indeed lying, he could simply ask the Maiya for forgiveness right? So much so for scaring someone for taking a leave.
